page.title: 05THE GENERAL AREA
page.content: This area is the north of Selkirk and comprises three estates Fairnilee, Yair and Sunderland Hall. The rest of the ground is forest and rough pasture. Some of the land incorporates the north common of Selkirk and is land granted to the town by Royal Charter. The forests are partly mixed wood and partly conifer grown as a cash crop. The three hills are Linglie, Peat Law and Cribs Hill. The Three Brethern are three piles of stones which mark the northern limit of the towns lands. Each year a cavalcade of horses go out to the Three Brethern when they ride the town's marches. The Ettrick and the Tweed are principal waterways and flow through the area.
